description: Israel’s full cabinet approved a ceasefire and hostage-prisoner exchange deal with Hamas, clearing the way for a six-week pause starting Sunday to the 15 months of war in Gaza.
title: Israel’s Cabinet Approves Deal for Ceasefire Starting Sunday

description: Upon taking his second oath of office as US president, Donald Trump is expected to make swift and extensive use of the unilateral powers he will wield. Trump is planning to sign a series of executive actions in his first days in office that would, among other things, set up the mechanics to carry out mass deportations, put a hiring freeze on the federal workforce, and authorize new drilling on federal lands, according to people familiar with the efforts. Many of his anticipated executive actions
title: How US Presidents Wield Power With Executive Orders

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Not Letting Cold Deter Inaugural Party Atmosphere

description: Vivek Ramaswamy, the former presidential candidate and biotech entrepreneur partnering with Elon Musk on a project to slash the size of the federal government, plans to announce a 2026 campaign for Ohio governor, according to a campaign operative familiar with his thinking.
title: Ramaswamy Will Use DOGE as Springboard to Run for Ohio Governor

description: The Biden administration has distributed at least $26 billion of dollars in financing to clean-energy companies in its final days before President-elect Donald Trump takes off.
title: Biden Gives $26 Billion for Clean-Energy Projects in Final Days

description: Paraguay President Santiago Peña called President-elect Donald Trump’s incoming foreign policy team a “dream come true” as his nation stands to become more relevant in the next US administration.
title: Paraguay, a Remote Nation, Thrilled to Be on Trump’s Radar

description: A former Mozambique finance minister was sentenced to 8 1/2 years in prison by a US judge for his role in a $2 billion bond fraud that ensnared Credit Suisse Group AG and triggered a financial crisis for the African nation.
title: Ex-Mozambique Minister Gets 8 1/2 Years in US Bond Fraud Case

description: The US Supreme Court said it will consider whether a Maryland school system is violating the Constitution by incorporating LGBTQ-friendly books into the elementary school curriculum without giving parents the right to opt out.
title: Supreme Court Will Hear Clash Over LGBTQ-Themed Schoolbooks

description: Microsoft Corp.’s $13 billion investment in OpenAI raises concerns that the tech giant could extend its dominance in cloud computing into the nascent artificial intelligence market, the Federal Trade Commission said in a report released Friday.
title: Microsoft-OpenAI Partnership Raises Antitrust Concerns, FTC Says

description: A Bolivian judge ordered the arrest of Evo Morales on Friday, inflicting another blow to the socialist former president’s ambition to run in this year’s election.
title: Bolivian Judge Orders Arrest of Ex-President Morales on Human-Trafficking Charges

description: The Biden administration finalized a record $15 billion loan guarantee to PG&E Corp. in one of the Biden’s administration’s final acts before President-elect Donald Trump takes power Monday.
title: PG&E Gets Record $15 Billion Loan in One of Biden’s Final Acts

description: President Javier Milei made good on his promise to deliver a fiscal surplus in his first year, achieving a feat not seen in over a decade in Argentina’s deficit-prone economy.
title: Milei’s Budget Cuts Nets Argentina First Surplus in Over a Decade

description: Colombia’s government suspended peace talks with the world’s oldest guerrilla movement after a series of massacres spread terror in one of the group’s heartlands.
title: Colombia Breaks Off Peace Talks as Rebels Seek Massive Land Grab

description: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced Friday he will appoint his lieutenant governor, Jon Husted, to replace Vice President-elect JD Vance in the US Senate.
title: Ohio Lieutenant Governor Tapped to Replace JD Vance in US Senate

description: Traders snapped up bullish option bets Friday on exchange-traded funds linked to Chinese stock indexes after US President-elect Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping discussed trade and other topics.
title: Traders Pile into Bullish China ETF Wagers After Trump-Xi Call

description: President Joe Biden’s $52 billion bid to transform the domestic chip industry — one of the most ambitious pieces of US industrial policy since World War II — is about to enter a pivotal stage: life under a new administration.
title: Biden’s Chips Team Hands Off $52 Billion Program to a Skeptical Trump

description: The US Supreme Court has ended TikTok’s nine-month legal battle, forcing leaders both within the company and in Beijing to consider a dwindling set of alternatives for keeping the popular video-sharing app alive.
title: TikTok’s Future Hinges on Trump Following Supreme Court Loss

description: Donald Trump pledged to create “the greatest sovereign wealth fund of them all.” His advisers think one way to do it is a government agency they bet can help mobilize hundreds of billions from Wall Street.
title: Trump Team Has Wealth-Fund Ambitions for Small Lending Agency

description: Rachel Reeves and Keir Starmer end the week in a better political position than they began it. Market movements have settled, the chatter about Reeves’ position has mostly ended, and the pair have shifted into fight-back mode.
title: Ailbhe Rea: Starmer and Reeves Shift Into Fight-Back Mode

description: Russia’s war on Ukraine has been dictated as much by events in the air as by territorial gains on the front line.
title: All About the Missiles Russia and Ukraine Are Firing

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would move his swearing-in ceremony and inaugural address indoors due to extreme cold forecast in Washington for Monday.
title: Trump Says Inaugural Ceremony to Move Indoors Due to Severe Cold

description: Kristi Noem, President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to be Homeland Security secretary, on Friday described what she saw as flaws with the government’s cybersecurity agency and indicated the incoming administration would shrink it.
title: Kristi Noem Grilled on Terrorism, Cybersecurity at US Senate Hearing

description: A new kind of leader has emerged from a record year of elections and 2025 will likely deliver more surprises.
title: Global Voter Fury Ushers in Era of the ‘Authoritarian Populist’

description: Thousands of Romanian police protested against the government’s recent spending cuts as the country struggles to reduce the European Union’s highest budget deficit.
title: Romanian Police Officers Protest as Cabinet Seeks Spending Cuts

description: The coming legal clash between blue states and the Trump administration is already hitting courts across the US.
title: Trump’s Legal Showdown With Blue State AGs Is Already Happening

description: The Supreme Court upheld a law that threatens to shut down the wildly popular TikTok social media platform in the US as soon as Sunday, ruling that free speech rights must yield to concerns that Chinese control of the app creates a national-security risk.
title: Supreme Court Upholds Law That Threatens US TikTok Ban

description: Ex-Moscow investment banker Ruben Vardanyan and 15 other Armenian leaders of the formerly contested Nagorno-Karabakh region went on trial in Azerbaijan on Friday.
title: Azerbaijan Puts Armenian Ex-Leaders of Nagorno-Karabakh on Trial

description: President Joe Biden declared the 1972 Equal Rights Amendment as “the law of the land” on Friday, using one of the final days of his presidency to burnish his record on women’s rights.
title: Biden Affirms Equal Rights Amendment But Move Lacks Legal Effect

description: Mozambican opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane said he was open to pausing protests that have been hammering the southeast African nation, even as civil servants plan a pay strike.
title: Mozambique Opposition Chief Signals He’s Ready to Pause Protests

description: The European Union and Mexico agreed to a revamped free-trade agreement, just as both are under pressure from President-elect Donald Trump, who has threatened them with a new round of tariffs.
title: EU, Mexico Seal Trade Deal as Trump Threatens Both With Tariffs

description: The International Monetary Fund upgraded its global growth forecast for this year, spurred by stronger-than-expected US demand and slowing inflation worldwide that will let central banks continue to cut interest rates.
title: IMF Raises Global Economic Growth Forecast on Stronger US Demand

description: First came the raid on a Mexico City shopping center known for selling Chinese-made clothing, toys and electronics. Then, last month, tariffs of almost 20% on packages from foreign e-commerce companies including Temu and Shein Group, and even higher duties on some textiles.
title: Mexico Cozies Up to Trump With Crackdown on China Trade

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy hosted an increasingly popular Slovak opposition leader as Kyiv remains locked in a spat with the country’s premier over gas transit.
title: Zelenskiy Snubs Slovak Pro-Russian PM by Meeting Opposition

description: US President-elect Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping spoke by telephone on Friday, China’s official Xinhua reported, a pre-inauguration conversation that could set the tone for relations between the world’s two largest economies and main geopolitical rivals.
title: Trump and China’s Xi Hold Phone Call, Xinhua News Reports

description: Governor Tiff Macklem has successfully wrestled down one of the worst inflationary crises in the Bank of Canada’s history, putting his nation on track for a soft landing. US President-elect Donald Trump may dismantle all that with a stroke of a pen.
title: Canada’s Soft Landing in Jeopardy as Macklem Faces Trump Tariffs

description: Chrystia Freeland, the former Canadian finance minister who helped bring Justin Trudeau’s political career to an end when she resigned in December, has joined the race to replace him as prime minister.
title: Chrystia Freeland Joins Contest to Replace Canada’s Trudeau

description: Israel’s high-level security cabinet approved a ceasefire and hostage-prisoner exchange deal with Hamas, paving the way for a weeks-long pause from Sunday to the 15 months of fighting in Gaza.
title: Israel Security Cabinet Approves Deal for Ceasefire in Gaza

description: Some rules have been waived to encourage the swift replacement of burned-out homes. Fire experts say it’s critical that new homes be resilient to future risk.
title: Los Angeles Pushes to Rebuild Homes Fast, Despite Wildfire Danger

description: Lithuania plans to increase defense spending to deter potential threats from Russia after US President-elect Donald Trump urged European allies to boost funds for the military.
title: Lithuania Pledges to Boost Defense Spending After Trump Demand

description: Massachusetts Governor Maura Healey pledged to work with the state’s legislature to reform an overloaded emergency shelter system that’s costing about $1 billion a year.
title: Massachusetts Weighs Tougher Shelter Rules as Trump Looms

description: The European Union is debating whether to drop a sensitive trade investigation against China over alleged coercive activity targeting Lithuania, a prospect that’s frustrated officials in Washington, where the incoming Trump team sees it as capitulation to Beijing.
title: EU Debates Dropping China Trade Case, Frustrating Trump Advisers

description: Nigeria’s powerful state governors dropped their opposition to an overhaul of the nation’s taxes, provided that plans to cut corporate tax and raise value added tax are abandoned.
title: Nigeria State Governors Give Conditional Backing to Tax Reforms

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz pushed back against accusations that he is casting Ukraine aside in an attempt to drum up support for his trailing Social Democrats ahead of a snap election next month.
title: Scholz Denies Accusations of Putting His Own Political Survival Over Support for Ukraine

description: A key ally to Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said it’s breaking all negotiations, landing a blow to the Socialist government as it seeks to approve a new budget.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Loses Catalan Ally in Setback for Budget Talks

description: The former chancellor’s early life tells the story of a country at odds with itself.
title: Angela Merkel’s Memoir Explains Modern Germany’s Dilemma

description: At least three people were killed and many more injured in a Russian ballistic missile strike over Kryvyi Rih in central Ukraine, regional Governor Serhiy Lysak said in Telegram.
title: Kyiv Says Three Killed in Russian Missile Strike on Kryvyi Rih

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Iran Looks to Putin for Shelter Against Trump

description: Surging long-term interest rates and stubborn inflation are inflaming divisions among congressional Republicans over paying for the sweeping tax cuts Donald Trump promised, complicating the path to passage with the party’s already tenuous majority.
title: Surging Long-Term Rates Stoke GOP Tensions on Paying for Tax Cut

description: The Philippine Navy on Friday said it held drills near a disputed South China Sea shoal, where a large Chinese vessel was spotted patrolling.
title: Philippines Holds Drills Near Disputed Shoal Amid China Tensions

description: South Korea may consider a plan to increase US food imports to help reduce the trade imbalance between the two countries should it emerge as a point of tension with Donald Trump’s incoming administration, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: South Korea May Consider More US Food Imports to Placate Trump

description: The task of fostering a meaningful recovery for Germany is in the hands of the next government after years of neglect hurt its growth potential, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.
title: Nagel Calls on Next German Government to Repair Ailing Economy

description: President Joe Biden will commute the sentences of nearly 2,500 non-violent drug offenders whose sentences were longer than they’d receive under current standards, the White House said in a statement on Friday.
title: Biden Will Commute Another 2,500 Sentences, White House Says

description: Japan’s primary balance is once again set to miss its long-standing target of achieving a balanced budget by the year ending March 2026.
title: Japan Now Expects to Miss Its 2025 Primary Balance Goal

description: Hungary’s anti-corruption agency itself became entangled in a graft probe after prosecutors raided its offices alleging the misuse of funds.
title: Hungarian Prosecutors Raid Anti-Graft Office Over Alleged Fraud

description: The toppling of France’s government last month has shaved 0.3 percentage points off output and deprived the state of much-needed tax revenue to repair the budget, according to new Finance Minister Eric Lombard.
title: French Finance Chief Says Government Collapse Dented Growth

description: New York Mayor Eric Adams will meet with Donald Trump on Friday to discuss New Yorkers’ priorities, the latest sign of cooperation between the embattled Democratic leader and the Republican president-elect who long called the city home.
title: New York Mayor Adams Plans Pre-Inauguration Meeting With Trump

description: The Yemen-based Houthis signaled a pause in their months-long attacks on commercial ships following a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas.
title: Houthis Signal Pause on Red Sea Ship Attacks After Gaza Truce

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said attempts to impeach Vice President Sara Duterte are ill-timed, as lawmakers will be busy ahead of the midterm elections in May.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Says Now Isn’t Time to Impeach VP Duterte

description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra said the country remains safe for tourists amid reports of a high-profile trafficking of a Chinese actor triggering mass group cancellations ahead of the Lunar New Year holidays.
title: Thai PM Reassures Tourists as Safety Fears Deter Some Chinese

description: The European Union should end sanctions against Russia because Donald Trump’s administration is poised to usher in a “new era” from next week, said Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
title: EU Should Move to End Sanctions Against Russia, Orban Says

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is due to host his Iranian counterpart, Masoud Pezeshkian, for a summit on Friday to sign a new pact, as the two countries brace for the return of US President-elect Donald Trump to the White House.
title: Russia and Iran to Sign Partnership Pact Ahead of New Trump Term

description: The sluggish economy has sparked fragmentation and frustration, throwing open the campaign for chancellor.
title: How Germany’s Parties Are Seeking to Win Over Skeptical Voters

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will skip US President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration on Monday but will send Vice President Han Zheng instead, the country’s Foreign Ministry said.
title: Xi to Skip Trump’s Inauguration, Sends Vice President Instead

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol will remain in detention for the time being over his ill-fated martial law declaration after a court rejected his request to be released following his arrest earlier this week.
title: South Korean President Yoon Remains in Detention for Time Being

description: Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said an agreement with Hamas to pause the war in Gaza has been finalized, suggesting it’s on track to begin on Sunday.
title: Netanyahu Says Israel-Hamas Deal to Pause Gaza War On Track

description: A US government investigation concluded that Chinese subsidies unfairly benefit the nation’s shipbuilding industry and harm American competitors, a decision that likely sets the stage for tariffs.
title: Trump Gets New Tool to Fight China With Findings on Shipbuilding

description: New Zealand is urging Canada’s next prime minister to respond to claims from rival dairy exporters that it is dumping low-price milk products on world markets.
title: New Zealand Urges Next Canadian Leader to Address Dairy Concerns

description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to name Brett Shumate to lead the US Department of Justice’s Civil Division, choosing a veteran litigator to run an office that will defend the incoming administration’s agenda in court, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: Trump Expected to Tap Jones Day Lawyer to Lead Civil Division
